review_title: Come for the pay, stay for the kids

cons: It is primarily relationship based. The first thing you should do upon arrival is get to know as many people as possible, build relationships so that you can be more productive.

review_title: A decent place to work and grow.
pros: To help develop the minds of the diverse student population. The university provides 8 hours sick per month that is cumulative in addition to 9.33 hours vacation per month up to five year and it increases by two hours years 6-10.  The university provides 13 paid holidays per year.
cons: A lot of the funding is from the sate and when we don't meet our projection for new student or don't retain others there can be a short fall in funds.

review_title: NCCU Biomedical and Pharmaceutical Science Funding and Leadership Review
job_title: Adjunct Laboratory Instructor in Chicago, IL
pros: Excellent leadership at the Provost Level.  Professors in physical, natural and health science are phenomenal.  Initiatives for research funding in the BRITE and BBRI are good.  Job market after graduating in the BRITE program are very good.  For students, plenty of experience in externships and internships are available.
cons: It may be difficult to get job placement if you don't establish roots there first.

review_title: I have had a great experience at NCCU
pros: Ability to work in an academic setting is thought provoking, and also inspirational to achieve personal enhancements by attaining  higher educational degrees.  To work in an environment of constant study is envigorating.
cons: Sometimes resources are limited, and whatever affects the state, affects the employee.

review_title: The best part of central is the community, In terms of job out look in opportunities its best to look elsewhere.
pros:
Amazing people to work with most of the time
Teachers care more about you on a personal level
A unique HBCU college life if your the social type
cons:
Organization
Lack of Communication between departments
Beurocracy and requirements of staff can be stressfull
Some teachers are incompetent or focus only on research
Too few have truly good grades and outstanding achievements

job_title: Associate Professor Computer Science in Durham, NC
pros: Great coworkers and students. The institution has great potential as a liberal arts institution but fails to stick to that niche.
cons: Incompetent senior administrative leadership.  Very high turn over in senior leadership.  Decisions made at the top often impact the upper administration pay and promotion while SPA and epa non faculty positions are often sacrificed all together.  Friends are hired for positions instead of the most qualified or experienced and "appointed" to top positions.  Personnel practices should be investigated.

pros: The family oriented environment, knowledgeable management, educational and growth opportunities, flexible work schedule and awesome benefits
cons: Parking and condition of some buildings, construction

job_title: Business & Technology Applications Analyst in Durham, NC
pros: Great benefits and flexible working with the state of North Carolina.
cons: Lack of official technical training. The CIO has no idea how her department runs.  The same management goes to all the professional development and conference. (If you're a manager why don't you send your staff to the conferences.

pros: Supervisor in the counselor education program was flexible as long as we met the required 20 hours/week. You can use bank hours if you have worked more than 20 and save up those hours. The pay was monthly and consistent.
cons: Some GA's had more opportunities to present research at conferences than others.

review_title: I was a legal research assistant for a professor at the school
pros: I liked the flexibility of my hours and the workload was manageable.
cons: Its really hard to get my supervisors to be references for me, tracking them down is a nightmare.

pros: I enjoyed working with the students and some of the professors. The work/life balance of a college campus is terrific and the energy of the young people rejuvenated me after 16 years in corporate life.
cons: The previous chancellor left the university in a very difficult situation. There are faculty who should retire or be reassigned, students who aren't qualified to attend college and a lack of resources in most departments.

pros: Observe student's use of Library data available to them at different departments and majors
cons: Regular updating of data on weekly basis to reflect an ongoing usage and prepare semester report

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Durham, NC
pros:
1. Access to highly rated professors in Physics
2.  Ample teaching opportunities
3. Great support from teaching and non-teaching staff
4. Friendly/family atmosphere
cons: Personally, I do not really see any reason not to recommend any student to pursue his/her education at NCCU.
